question_sentence: The high-stakes midterm elections were held this week. In which key state did Democrats flip a Senate seat the GOP had held for more than a decade?
evidence: Democrats will pick up a Senate seat in Pennsylvania, CNN projects, with Democrat John Fetterman defeating Republican Mehmet Oz.

question_sentence: Many Florida residents who are still recovering from Hurricane Ian were hit this week by a tropical storm. What was the name of the storm?
evidence: Tropical Storm Nicole made landfall as a Category 1 hurricane in Florida on Thursday before weakening. The storm knocked out power for hundreds of thousands of residents and prompted the closure of many schools and the cancellation of hundreds of flights.

question_sentence: Which tech giant announced that shipments of a popular product lineup will be “temporarily impacted” by Covid restrictions in China?
evidence: One of Apple’s assembly facilities located in the central Chinese city of Zhengzhou is “currently operating at significantly reduced capacity” due to Covid curbs. As a result, Apple said it is expecting delays in shipments of its iPhone 14 models.

question_sentence: Which country’s lawmakers have urged state officials to “show no leniency” to protesters as thousands of people continue to rally on the streets?
evidence: Iranian lawmakers called for protesters to be taught a “good lesson” to deter others who threaten the authority of the Iranian government. The Islamic Republic is facing one of the biggest shows of dissent ever following the death of Mahsa Amini.

question_sentence: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced layoffs this week. Approximately how many employees were affected at the parent company of Facebook?
evidence: Meta’s job cuts will impact 11,000 employees and mark the first broad headcount reductions in the company’s history, Zuckerberg wrote in a blog post to employees. The significant layoffs at Meta come just days after Twitter, Lyft and Amazon also announced sweeping job cuts or pauses in hiring.

question_sentence: A single winning ticket for the record $2.04 billion Powerball lottery jackpot was sold this week in which state?
evidence: The lone winning ticket was sold in Altadena, California, lottery officials said Tuesday, making one lucky person the winner of the largest lottery prize ever.

question_sentence: US women’s basketball star Brittney Griner was transferred to a Russian penal colony this week. How many years is she due to serve for her drug smuggling sentence?
evidence: Griner is currently due to serve a nine-year sentence in Russia. This week, she was transferred to a penal colony where inmates are often subjected to tedious manual labor – such as sewing uniforms for the Russian army or making buttonholes for garments.

question_sentence: For a brief period this week, which color did Twitter use as its new “official” check mark to verify government accounts, media, and major brands?
evidence: After receiving widespread criticism over its plan to change the meaning of its blue check mark, the platform briefly debuted a gray check mark to label government accounts, major brands and media outlets. However, hours after it was introduced, Elon Musk changed his mind and rolled back the feature.

question_sentence: Which state approved a ballot measure this week that will legalize recreational marijuana?
evidence: CNN projects that Maryland — along with Missouri — will approve measures to legalize recreational marijuana use, while voters in Arkansas, North Dakota and South Dakota rejected similar measures. In Maryland specifically, individuals who were previously convicted of cannabis possession and intent to distribute will be able to apply for record expungement.

question_sentence: The CDC issued a warning this week about a deadly listeria outbreak in six states. Which food items were linked to the outbreak?
evidence: An outbreak of listeria has been linked to contaminated deli meat and cheese. A total of 16 people across the US have been infected, and 13 have been hospitalized, according to reports from six states.

question_sentence: Which state will hold a runoff election for a U.S. Senate seat, after neither candidate cleared the 50% threshold to win outright?
After firing head coach Frank Reich, which franchise legend did the Indianapolis Colts hire as interim head coach?
Moderna and Pfizer-BioNTech are looking to combine a COVID-19 shot with a vaccine for which disease?
What did TSA agents find stuffed inside a traveler's raw chicken at an airport in Florida?
In which state was Democrat Maura Healey elected as the nation's first openly lesbian governor?
Season 5 of “The Crown” was released this week on Netflix. Who plays Princess Diana in the series?
Chris Evans was voted People’s Sexiest Man Alive for 2022. What role did he play in a Pixar movie?
Democrat Maxwell Frost made history when he became the first member of Gen Z to be elected to Congress. How old is Frost?
A growing body of research has linked a pregnant person's frequent use of this drug to autism and ADHD in their child.
The World Cup roster for the United States men’s national team was announced this week. Where is the World Cup being held?
Ron DeSantis won what percentage of the vote in the US midterm elections this week to secure re-election as governor of Florida?
evidence: The huge win against Democrat Charlie Crist ‘positions DeSantis for a potential 2024 presidential campaign’, said Vox.

question_sentence: An LGBTQ+ football supporters group has criticised which former England player for becoming a paid ambassador for the 2022 Qatar World Cup?
evidence: Three Lions Pride’s co-founder said that the LGBTQ+ ‘football family’ had previously put the former England captain ‘on a pedestal’ and considered him ‘a great ally’. Beckham will reportedly make £150m from the deal.

question_sentence: In a world-first clinical trial, how many people this week received transfusions of lab-grown red blood cells?
evidence: Scientists hope to be able to manufacture ultra-rare blood groups for patients with sickle cell anaemia and others with very specific requirements.

question_sentence: Shadow immigration minister Stephen Kinnock said this week that Labour is looking ‘very, very carefully’ at a scheme for what?
choices: Making voting in elections a legal requirement
Rolling out ID cards for UK citizens
evidence: After Kinnock made the comments to Times Radio, shadow home secretary Yvette Cooper shot down the idea of reviving the Blair-era policy on BBC Radio 4’s Today programme.

question_sentence: Which Tory MP is not reported to be on Boris Johnson’s resignation honours list?
evidence: The list has proved controversial after The Times reported that Johnson put forward two former advisers, Charlotte Owen and Ross Kempsell, to become the youngest-ever life peers.

question_sentence: Using artificial intelligence, a computer scientist believes he has identified a man who is an exact match for Lord Lucan, the murderer who disappeared in 1974. Where is he living?
evidence: An algorithm ran 4,000 cross-checks of photos of the pensioner and Lucan. Professor Hassan Ugail said they were the same individual or like ‘identical twins’.

question_sentence: A study published this week found that which animal tends to break up conflicts between other members of its own species?
evidence: After studying more than 100 pigs in Italy, researchers found they are likely to intervene in a conflict between other pigs to help smooth things over.

question_sentence: Which company has been criticised by privacy campaign group Big Brother Watch for allegedly facilitating stalking?
evidence: PimEyes has said its facial recognition technology is ‘not intended for the surveillance of others’, and claims to be safer than social media sites with regards to stalking. Find out more on The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: England is set to gain how many constituencies as a result of boundary changes to the UK’s political map?
evidence: Scotland would lose two seats and Wales would lose eight as a result of changes that could turn a number of safe seats into marginal battlegrounds.

question_sentence: What did the selection committee that decides the annual DreamToys shortlist say was a ‘strong consideration’ this year?
evidence: Paul Reader, chair of the DreamToys selection committee, said that toys’ prices had been taken into account, as 2022 has been a ‘challenging year for many families’.
